cf8e956b-5440-5c01-93db-9b4ac1a1a668.title: In the event that PCC pavements are poured when the air temperature, aggregates or water is below 10oC or the completed pavement is expected to be exposed to freezing conditions the pavements must be protected with insulation coverings (plastic/ bubble wrap) during the first 72 hours of curing to maintain a minimum temperature of 10°C.

06ac7c0f-8ca5-53cf-b6aa-735917b421ba.title: Concrete shall not be placed when the temperature of the concrete mix is below 10°C

734f0ae0-0274-5369-a5d8-9227fb2a3a13.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Evaporation rate recorded every hour 0- 0.8kg/m2/hr or every 15min int 0.8-0.9kg/m2/hr. If evaporation rate is >= 1kg/m2/h works must cease and a transverse construction joint installed

1f8f52bf-7fa8-5afd-a5fe-15d75a96cb3e.title: RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed & CL009E

4430eeb4-d5b6-5481-897d-d04d683e9b4f.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall comprise of traverse finishing, longitudinal straight-edge finishing, floating and then broom finishing, in that order.Brooming shall be in a direction at right angles to the direction of the placing of the concrete.

33ab6150-895a-5afe-ba8f-e78316b79280.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete to be wet cured for a minimum of 7 days. Initial Curing shall commence immediately after finishing operations have been completed. Moist curing to commence as soon as possible after finishing. This will be wetted hessian mats covering the pour. The mats shall overlap to ensure sufficient coverage. Mats shall be kept saturated for not less than 7 days. Curing methods and details shown on post pour checklist CL009D.
